org.transitime.applications

Class Core

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.applications.Core

  • public class Core
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class for running a Transitime Core real-time data processing system. Handles command line arguments and then initiates AVL feed.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Method Detail

      • createCore

        public static Core createCore()
        Creates the Core object for the application. There can only be one Core object per application. Uses CoreConfig.getAgencyId() to determine the agencyId. This means it typically uses the agency ID specified by the Java property -Dtransitime.core.agencyId .

        Usually doesn't need to be called directly because can simply use Core.getInstance().

        Synchronized to ensure that don't create more than a single Core.

        Returns:
        The Core singleton, or null if could not create it

      • getInstance

        public static Core getInstance()
        For obtaining singleton Core object

      • getServiceUtils

        public ServiceUtils getServiceUtils()
        Returns the ServiceUtils object that can be reused for efficiency.
        Returns:

      • getTime

        public Time getTime()
        For when want to use methods in Time. This is important when need methods that access a Calendar a lot. By putting the Calendar in Time it can be shared.
        Returns:

      • getSystemTime

        public long getSystemTime()
        For when need system time but might be in playback mode. If in playback mode then will be using a SettableSystemTime.
        Returns:
        The system epoch time

      • getSystemDate

        public java.util.Date getSystemDate()
        For when need system time but might be in playback mode. If in playback mode then will be using a SettableSystemTime.
        Returns:
        The system epoch time
